intro: Spigelia andina, commonly known as the Andean spindleflower, is a perennial herb native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often toxic compounds. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular and typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Spigelia andina is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
